website_summaries.verdict: The Vizio M551D-A2R is a surprisingly stylish, affordable LED-backlit HDTV that sports tons of features, good picture quality, and out-of-the-box 3D for eight people.
cons: 3D shows crosstalk when viewed too close or off-axis
Dark scenes can look slightly muddy

customer_reviews.title: I am disappointed with the remote
customer_reviews.text: After much research, I ordered the Vizio M552i-B2, and it has exceeded my extreme expectations. This set has ramped up my addiction to Blu-rays with its phenomenal display. I stressed it out with 2001: A SPACE ODYSSEY and the set perfectly handled the deep black space, tiny pinpoints of stars and the floating small figure of an astronaut. I am disappointed with the remote, which is not ergonomically-designed or illuminated, forcing me to put colored dots of paint on it to help me navigate in a dark room. Because all the reviews said the Smart-TV functions are not-quite-ready-for-primtetime, I have not tried them out - yet. Speakers are only adequate; I recommend the sound stage as well-worth the supplemental expense.
customer_reviews.author: wolfster

customer_reviews.title: Just what I'd hoped it would be.
customer_reviews.text: Really, about as good as I can imagine. Excellent picture which can be custom adjusted separately for each input. Sound was adequate, but really fine with a sound bar added. Highly adjustable for various accessories. Nice small sturdy stand. I use this with Chromecast and a Sony sound bar with HDMI ARC; turning on the Chromecast or the Blu ray player also turns on the sound bar, and the Blu ray remote (Sony) is easily programmed to turn off (or on) the tv and adjust sound volume (code 04). I use the Vizio remote only to control direct streaming of Amazon movies.
customer_reviews.author: Arnold Banner

customer_reviews.title: Decent, for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Had this for awhile now...maybe six months or so. The picture is OK, however it tends to ghost when a dark scene is showing. Many controls for the picture...some are worthwhile, some not. The smart TV feature is OK, but I've had some issues here and there with lock-ups on updating, and the like. The Rhapsody app stopped working, and then disappeared from the smart TV. It's way cheaper than say a Samsung, but not as elegant, and lacks a lot of the whistles and bells. Overall, though, a decent TV.
customer_reviews.author: JAH

customer_reviews.title: Not a good compromise since the DVD player goes to the TV ...
customer_reviews.text: Have trouble with lip sync using a soundbar. Had to connect soundbar to Dish Hopper with optical cable to get sync ok. Not a good compromise since the DVD player goes to the TV via HDMI cable and have to use the TV sound system instead of the soundbar with DVDs and with Netflix. The TV's lip sync adjustment made the mismatch worse not better when the soundbar was connected to the TV analog audio out or optical audio out. Picture is great!

customer_reviews.title: This TV is great.
customer_reviews.text: This TV is great. We used it with Verizon FIOS for a bit, and then "cut the cable" and now get our TV via "free, over-the-air" antenna broadcasts. The tuner does a really good job pulling in distant channels. We also love the built in "smart features" that allow it to connect to Netflix, Pandora and other services. Sharp picture and good performance.
